gpt-message.content: You are an expert in hardware design with a deep understanding of Verilog RTL codes. Now I want to train a large language model for code comment generation tasks specifically focused on Verilog RTL codes. And I want you to help me process the raw data, transforming it into suitable formats that can serve as inputs and outputs for the model.

Name of the module and its functionality is as follows: 
Module name: mcb_soft_calibration

Explanation: This module performs soft calibration for a memory controller block (MCB). It handles the initialization and dynamic calibration of I/O termination and DQS (data strobe) delays. The module goes through various states to configure termination resistances, adjust DQS delays, and optimize signal integrity. It includes processes for both input termination calibration and dynamic DQS calibration. The module also manages self-refresh operations and responds to system reset conditions. Overall, it aims to improve the timing and signal quality for memory interfaces, particularly for DDR (Double Data Rate) memory types.

Input and output ports and their explanation is as follows: 
Input ports:
UI_CLK, RST, PLL_LOCK, SELFREFRESH_REQ, SELFREFRESH_MCB_MODE, RZQ_IN, RZQ_IODRP_SDO, ZIO_IN, ZIO_IODRP_SDO, MCB_UOSDO, MCB_UODONECAL, MCB_UOREFRSHFLAG, MCB_UODATA, MCB_UODATAVALID, MCB_UOCMDREADY, MCB_UO_CAL_START.

Explanation:
These ports are used for clock input, reset, PLL status, self-refresh control, I/O termination calibration, and various MCB status and data signals.

Output ports:
DONE_SOFTANDHARD_CAL, SELFREFRESH_MCB_REQ, SELFREFRESH_MODE, IODRP_ADD, IODRP_SDI, RZQ_IODRP_CS, ZIO_IODRP_CS, MCB_UIADD, MCB_UISDI, MCB_UICS, MCB_UIDRPUPDATE, MCB_UIBROADCAST, MCB_UIADDR, MCB_UICMDEN, MCB_UIDONECAL, MCB_UIDQLOWERDEC, MCB_UIDQLOWERINC, MCB_UIDQUPPERDEC, MCB_UIDQUPPERINC, MCB_UILDQSDEC, MCB_UILDQSINC, MCB_UIREAD, MCB_UIUDQSDEC, MCB_UIUDQSINC, MCB_RECAL, MCB_UICMD, MCB_UICMDIN, MCB_UIDQCOUNT, MCB_SYSRST, Max_Value, CKE_Train.

Explanation:
These ports are used to indicate calibration status, control self-refresh operations, manage I/O termination, control MCB operations, adjust DQS delays, and provide various control and status signals for the memory interface calibration process.

Internal signals and their explanation is as follows: 
Internal signals:
STATE, P_Term, N_Term, P_Term_s, N_Term_s, P_Term_w, N_Term_w, P_Term_Prev, N_Term_Prev, IODRPCTRLR_MEMCELL_ADDR, IODRPCTRLR_WRITE_DATA, Active_IODRP, IODRPCTRLR_R_WB, IODRPCTRLR_CMD_VALID, IODRPCTRLR_USE_BKST, MCB_CMD_VALID, MCB_USE_BKST, Pre_SYSRST, IODRP_SDO, Max_Value_Previous, count, counter_en, First_Dyn_Cal_Done, DQS_DELAY_INITIAL, DQS_DELAY, TARGET_DQS_DELAY, counter_inc, counter_dec, RST_reg, Block_Reset, MCB_UODATAVALID_U, LastPass_DynCal, First_In_Term_Done, PLL_LOCK_R1, PLL_LOCK_R2, SELFREFRESH_REQ_R1, SELFREFRESH_REQ_R2, SELFREFRESH_REQ_R3, SELFREFRESH_MCB_MODE_R1, SELFREFRESH_MCB_MODE_R2, SELFREFRESH_MCB_MODE_R3, WAIT_SELFREFRESH_EXIT_DQS_CAL, PERFORM_START_DYN_CAL_AFTER_SELFREFRESH, START_DYN_CAL_STATE_R1, PERFORM_START_DYN_CAL_AFTER_SELFREFRESH_R1, Rst_condition1, WAIT_200us_COUNTER, WaitTimer, WarmEnough.

Explanation:
1. STATE: Represents the current state of the calibration process.
2. P_Term, N_Term: Store termination values for P and N termination.
3. P_Term_s, N_Term_s, P_Term_w, N_Term_w: Skewed termination values.
4. P_Term_Prev, N_Term_Prev: Previous termination values.
5. IODRPCTRLR_MEMCELL_ADDR, IODRPCTRLR_WRITE_DATA: IODRP controller address and data.
6. Active_IODRP: Indicates which IODRP is currently active.
7. IODRPCTRLR_R_WB, IODRPCTRLR_CMD_VALID, IODRPCTRLR_USE_BKST: IODRP controller control signals.
8. MCB_CMD_VALID, MCB_USE_BKST: MCB control signals.
9. Pre_SYSRST: Internal reset signal.
10. IODRP_SDO: IODRP serial data output.
11. Max_Value_Previous: Stores previous maximum value.
12. count, counter_en: Counter for timing purposes.
13. First_Dyn_Cal_Done: Indicates if first dynamic calibration is complete.
14. DQS_DELAY_INITIAL, DQS_DELAY, TARGET_DQS_DELAY: DQS delay values.
15. counter_inc, counter_dec: Counters for incrementing and decrementing delays.
16. RST_reg, Block_Reset: Reset control signals.
17. MCB_UODATAVALID_U: Registered version of MCB_UODATAVALID.
18. LastPass_DynCal: Indicates the type of last calibration pass.
19. First_In_Term_Done: Indicates if first input termination is complete.
20. PLL_LOCK_R1, PLL_LOCK_R2: Registered versions of PLL_LOCK.
21. SELFREFRESH_REQ_R1, SELFREFRESH_REQ_R2, SELFREFRESH_REQ_R3: Registered versions of SELFREFRESH_REQ.
22. SELFREFRESH_MCB_MODE_R1, SELFREFRESH_MCB_MODE_R2, SELFREFRESH_MCB_MODE_R3: Registered versions of SELFREFRESH_MCB_MODE.
23. WAIT_SELFREFRESH_EXIT_DQS_CAL, PERFORM_START_DYN_CAL_AFTER_SELFREFRESH: Self-refresh control signals.
24. START_DYN_CAL_STATE_R1, PERFORM_START_DYN_CAL_AFTER_SELFREFRESH_R1: Registered versions of self-refresh control signals.
25. Rst_condition1: Reset condition signal.
26. WAIT_200us_COUNTER: Counter for 200μs wait period.
27. WaitTimer: Timer for wait states.
28. WarmEnough: Indicates if warm-up period is complete.
